abstract: Archaeologists dig out three cast iron Civil War cannons, roughly 150 years old and ranging from nine to 12 feet, from Pee Dee River in South Carolina.
lead_paragraph: Archaeologists plucked three cast iron Civil War cannons nine to to 12 feet long from the Pee Dee River on Tuesday and marveled that 150 years in the muck had not done them major damage.

headline.main: South Carolina: Civil War Cannons Pulled From 150-Year Bath
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Civil War Cannons Pulled From 150-Year Bath

snippet: Archaeologists plucked three cast iron Civil War cannons nine to to 12 feet long from the Pee Dee River on Tuesday and marveled that 150 years in the muck had not done them major damage.
